data:
John McGreevy News and Awards John McGreevy promoted to Associate Professor Renormalization group constructions of topological quantum liquids and beyond, B. Swingle and J. McGreevy, Phys. Rev. B92, 085024 (2015) [ arXiv:1407.8203 [cond-mat.str-el]]. A quantum electron star , A.~Allais, J.~McGreevy, S.~J.~Suh, Phys.~Rev.~Lett.~{\bf 108}, 231602 (2012) [arXiv:1202.5308v1 [hep-th]]. Non-Abelian statistics versus the Witten anomaly , J. McGreevy, B. Swingle, Phys. Rev.  D 84, 065019 (2011) [arXiv:1106.0004 [hep-th]]. From black holes to strange metals , (Journal title: Strange metal transport realized by gauge/gravity duality), T. Faulkner, N. Iqbal, H. Liu, J. McGreevy, D. Vegh, Science  329, 1043 (2010) [arXiv:1003.1728 [hep-th]]. Holographic duality with a view toward many-body physics , J. McGreevy, Adv. High Energy Phys. 2010:723105 (2010)
[arXiv:0909.0518 [hep-th]]. John McGreevy Ph. D., Stanford University, 2002 Office: MH 5222 Phone: 858-534-1837 jamcgreevy@ucsd.edu Professor McGreevy's current research centers on the study and application of quantum field theory, both in condensed matter physics and in high energy physics.
